intro: Hebanthe, commonly known as the false nettle, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Malvaceae. It consists of several species that are typically herbaceous and can be found in tropical and subtropical regions. The plants often have opposite, ovate to lance-shaped leaves with serrated edges. They produce small, clustered flowers that are usually pink or white in color. Hebanthe species are often used in traditional medicine and have a variety of ecological roles in their native habitats.
